org.eclipse.keyple.plugin.remotese.nativese

Class SlaveAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.keyple.plugin.remotese.nativese.SlaveAPI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.keyple.core.seproxy.event.ObservableReader.ReaderObserver, org.eclipse.keyple.core.util.Observable.Observer<org.eclipse.keyple.core.seproxy.event.ReaderEvent>, INativeReaderService, DtoHandler

    public class SlaveAPI
extends java.lang.Object
implements INativeReaderService, DtoHandler, org.eclipse.keyple.core.seproxy.event.ObservableReader.ReaderObserver
    SlaveAPI is the main component of the Remote Se Architecture on the slave side.

    It allows also to connect/disconnect a reader trhough dedicated methods

    It handles incoming KeypleDto and transfer them to the right SeReader

    Configure the SlaveAPI with a DtoNode to enable communication with the MasterAPI

        public void disconnectReader(java.lang.String sessionId,
                             java.lang.String nativeReaderName)
                      throws org.eclipse.keyple.core.seproxy.exception.KeypleReaderException
        Disconnect a SeReader. Matching virtual session will be destroyed on Master node.
        Specified by:
        disconnectReader in interface INativeReaderService
        Parameters:
        sessionId - (optional)
        nativeReaderName - local name of the reader, will be used coupled with the nodeId to identify the virtualReader
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.keyple.core.seproxy.exception.KeypleReaderException - if an error occured while sending remote command
